netcal.metrics.ECE¶

class netcal.metrics.ECE(bins: int)¶

Bases: object

Metric for Expected Calibration Error (ECE). This metrics measures the expected difference between accuracy and confidence by grouping all samples (size \(N\)) into \(K\) bins and calculating

\[ECE = \sum_{i=1}^K \frac{|B_i|}{N} |\text{acc}_i - \text{conf}_i| ,\]

where \(\text{acc}_i\) and \(\text{conf}_i\) denote the accuracy and average confidence in the i-th bin and \(|B_i|\) denote the number of samples in bin \(B_i\).

Parameters

bins (int) – Number of bins. The output space is partitioned into M equally sized bins.

References

Naeini, Mahdi Pakdaman, Gregory Cooper, and Milos Hauskrecht: “Obtaining well calibrated probabilities using bayesian binning.” Twenty-Ninth AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence, 2015. Get source online

measure(X: numpy.ndarray, y: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

Measure calibration by given predictions with confidence and the according ground truth. Assume binary predictions with y=1.

Parameters

  • X (np.ndarray, shape=(n_samples, [n_classes])) – NumPy array with confidence values for each prediction. 1-D for binary classification, 2-D for multi class (softmax).

  • y (np.ndarray, shape=(n_samples,)) – NumPy 1-D array with ground truth labels.

Returns

Expected Calibration Error (ECE).

Return type

float
